name: LeConté Dill
bio:
LeConté Dill was born and raised in South Central Los Angeles and currently lives in Brooklyn. She earned degrees from Spelman College, UCLA, and the University of California, Berkeley. She has participated in the VONA/Voices Writing Workshops, as well as the Cave Canem workshops. LeConté’s work has been featured in the Berkeley Poetry Review, Cal Literature and Arts Magazine, The Feminist Wire, Los Angeles Magazine, and The Wide Shore. She coauthored, coedited, and copublished a poetry anthology with a group of teens from Oakland, California, entitled Y U Gotta Call It Ghetto? (2011). 

Currently, LeConté is an assistant professor at the SUNY Downstate School of Public Health, in Brooklyn.
